metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the unix-def:xinetd_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evaluate to true if the interpreter properly supports unix-def:xinetd_test.

criterion.comment: Test that the xinetd_object is supported with the protocol entity equal to some value and the service_name entity equal to some value.
Test that the xinetd_object is supported with the protocol entity not equal to some value and the service_name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the xinetd_object is supported with the protocol entity matching some regular expression and the service_name entity matching some regular expression.

xinetd_test.comment: Test that the xinetd_object is supported with the protocol entity equal to some value and the service_name entity equal to some value.
Test that the xinetd_object is supported with the protocol entity not equal to some value and the service_name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the xinetd_object is supported with the protocol entity matching some regular expression and the service_name entity matching some regular expression.

xinetd_object.comment: This xinetd_object represents an xinetd_item with a protocol equal to 'tcp' and a service_name equal to 'telnet'.
This xinetd_object represents an xinetd_item with a protocol not equal to 'tpc' and a service_name not equal to 'telnet'.
This xinetd_object represents an xinetd_item with a protocol that matches the regular expression '^t.p$'and a service_name that matches the regular expression '^te.n.t$'.

xinetd_state.comment: This state represents an xinetd_item with a protocol equal to 'tcp' and a service_name equal to 'telnet'.
This state represents an xinetd_item with a protocol not equal to 'tcp' and a service_name not equal to 'telnet'.
This state represents an xinetd_item with a protocol that matches the regular expression '^t.p$' and a service_name that matches the regular expression '^te.n.t$'.
